title: 2 months, 0 citations: MBTA releases numbers around its planned crackdown on fare evasion
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News The MBTA’s Fare Engagement Department began conducting checks to ensure riders have paid their fare on Sept.
A little more than seven weeks into its crackdown on fare evaders, the MBTA has issued zero citations and 85 warnings to passengers as of Tuesday, a spokesperson said.

title: Pastrnak and Lindholm star as the Bruins rally past the Islanders 5-2
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Boston Bruins Charlie McAvoy had two assists and Joonas Korpisalo made 33 saves for the Bruins, who won for just the second time since starting the season 3-0.
Bruins center Morgan Geekie celebrates his goal during the third period.
AP Photo/Mark Stockwell BOSTON (AP) — David Pastrnak had a goal and an assist to help the Boston Bruins rally for a 5-2 victory over the New York Islanders on Tuesday night.

title: 2 men plead guilty to manslaughter in 2018 Roxbury slaying that killed Revere father
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News "I carried him, raised him, loved him, and dreamed of seeing him grow old,” the victim's mother wrote in a statement read aloud in court.
Boston Police on scene at a shooting by 31 Whittier St.
in January 2018.

title: Harvard conservative student magazine says it will continue publishing despite suspension
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Editor-in-Chief Richard Y.

title: Patriots reportedly trade Keion White to 49ers for two draft picks
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Keion White was a healthy scratch on Sunday in New England's win over Cleveland.
Keion White is heading to the Bay Area.
AP Photo/Stew Milne By Conor Ryan October 28, 2025 | 7:34 PM 2 minutes to read The New England Patriots are reportedly moving on from a former second-round pick.

title: Hampus Lindholm to return to Bruins lineup Tuesday, Mason Lohrei a healthy scratch
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins Lindholm had missed eight of Boston's last nine games due to a lower-body injury.
Hampus Lindholm is returning to Boston's lineup on Tuesday.
AP Photo/David Zalubowski By Conor Ryan October 28, 2025 | 7:11 PM 2 minutes to read The Bruins’ beleaguered blue line is receiving some reinforcements on Tuesday.

title: A new Trader Joe’s is set to open in Boston this week
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Boston’s newest Trader Joe’s location in West Roxbury is gearing up to open this Thursday.
The Trader Joe’s store in Hadley.
Jonathan Wiggs / The Boston Globe By Sana Muneer October 28, 2025 | 5:08 PM 1 minute to read Boston’s newest Trader Joe’s location in West Roxbury is gearing up to open this Thursday, the store said.

title: How love is at the heart of the scariest horror films
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters Akela Cooper, the screenwriter behind "American Horror Story," joins the latest Love Letters episode to talk about the horror of vulnerability — and opening yourself up to love.
Akela Cooper attends the Los Angeles Premiere Of Universal Pictures' "M3GAN" at TCL Chinese Theatre on December 07, 2022 in Hollywood, California.
